pullrequest.title: First step in transition to ign-math

content.raw:
[I've modified](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/commits/bf6aed1b3007424b73f5bd8ac2f768393a838ae3) the Windows script to install ign-math2.zip. 

However, [this is broken](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_windows/job/gazebo-any-devel-windows7-amd64/21/console). When we use the cmake module in Windows (like what we do for sdformat) all is fine when you build sdformat from source. The cmake module is being generated with [***paths*** relative to that compilation](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/src/83baead60039d607100c9d5a84ca7322c935ca5a/cmake/ignition-math-config.cmake.in?at=default#cl-18) which is not the same as the continuous integration job.

Or we modify the cmake module not to check for the library or we modify the Windows script to build ign-math from source, like what we are doing with sdformat and it is recommended in the README.md.
content.html:
I've modified the Windows script to install ign-math2.zip.

However, this is broken. When we use the cmake module in Windows (like what we do for sdformat) all is fine when you build sdformat from source. The cmake module is being generated with paths relative to that compilation which is not the same as the continuous integration job.

Or we modify the cmake module not to check for the library or we modify the Windows script to build ign-math from source, like what we are doing with sdformat and it is recommended in the README.md.

pull_request.title: First step in transition to ign-math

pullrequest.title: First step in transition to ign-math

content.raw: `Gazebo::math` migration instead of just migration? And maybe mention here or in the ign-math-migration.md file that we will remove gazebo::math in gazebo7?
content.html: Gazebo::math migration instead of just migration? And maybe mention here or in the ign-math-migration.md file that we will remove gazebo::math in gazebo7?

content.raw: The `ign-math2` release branch was needed. `default` should now work as well.
content.html: The ign-math2 release branch was needed. default should now work as well.

pull_request.title: First step in transition to ign-math

update.description:
We will move to use the ign-math library in Gazebo6. This is the first pull request along this trajectory.

A `libignition-math2-dev` debian is available.

**Things to note**

1. ign-math is now required
1. gazebo math is still available. The internal library will be deprecated in gazebo7, and removed in gazebo8.
1. There will a lot of files that get touched. I'll make many small pull requests, with this one being the largest.
1. Users will be affected. We follow the tick-tock model, so they will have plenty of time to migrate their code. 
    1. A migration tutorial will be created in the near future to help people transition.
    1. Examples will be added, as shown in this pull request.
1. We can also look forward to a migration of gazebo's transport system to ign-transport. 

** New Jenkins Builds**

[Nvidia](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/172/)

[No gpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/228/)


** Update (05/18) **

1. Updated [Windows install tutorial](#!/osrf/gazebo_tutorials/pull-request/218)
1. New jenkins builds are in the queue
    1. [Homebrew clean](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/191/)
    1. [Nvidia clean ](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/212//)
    2. [no-gpu clean](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/277/)
1. This branch compiles and runs on Windows.
update.title: First step in transition to ign-math

pullrequest.title: First step in transition to ign-math

content.raw:
Are you able to compile all the examples in `examples/ignition`? I get an error linking `box.cc`:


```
#!c++

box.cc:(.text+0x211): undefined reference to `ignition::math::operator<<(std::ostream&, ignition::math::Box const&)'
```
content.html:
Are you able to compile all the examples in examples/ignition? I get an error linking box.cc:

box.cc:(.text+0x211): undefined reference to `ignition::math::operator<<(std::ostream&, ignition::math::Box const&)'
